greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: If n = Product (p_j^k_j), a(n) = numerator of Sum 1/p_j (the denominator of this sum is A007947).
comment: For n=1, the empty sum = 0 = 0/1 = a(1)/A007947(1), thus a(1) should be 0. - _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 04 2018
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..65537
maple: numer(add(1/a[k][1],k=1..nops(a))); end: seq(P(i),i=1..87); # _Paolo P. Lava_, Oct 17 2018
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
ext: Term a(1) changed to 0 by _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 04 2018
